radiographic_examinations.findings: Left kidney was atrophic; right kidney normal except for the presence of a single cortical cyst of 12-mm diameter.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At the last follow-up, creatinine clearance decreased from 46 ml/min to 25 ml/min.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Only the right kidney was functional.
Bilateral renal atrophy with multiple microcysts.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Renal function improved within the following weeks, with creatinine levels decreasing from 123 µmol/l at birth to 50 µmol/l at 2 and 6 months of age.
Creatinine levels increased up to 400 µmol/l just before death.
